reviews.review_msg: Excellent knowledge of the subject, and very good explanations! Makes a difficult subject very easy to understand. Marking-wise, he's fair too.
Arash was very helpful, one of the most helpful professors I have ever had at SFU. He is not easy and you have to work hard, however if you make an effort, he will do his best to help you.

Arash was very helpful, one of the most helpful professors I have ever had at SFU. He is not easy and you have to work hard, however if you make an effort, he will do his best to help you. I would recommend.
if you have any questions ,just go to his office. he is very easy with marking.

Awful teacher. He was not present for the first week of school because he 'did not know' he was suppose to be there. Did not teach in class, never replied his emails, and cannot understand his accent. Entire class did awful and he had to scale. I got a B+ even though I had no idea what a Java class is.

Doesn't care to teach. Doesn't know the subject matter at all. Doesn't care to fix mistakes. Makes mistakes everywhere every other slide. Assigns inappropriate, nearly impossible assignments. Exams are error ridden (once he repeated a one-liner question only 3 questions away).

First:  Arash is a very nice, and clearly brilliant person.
 However, his organizational skills were non-existent.  I don't think he was on time once.  His slides are incomprehensible and full of mistakes (in the code), he has no communication skills, and he obviously doesn't care about the subject.  Exams and assignments were ridiculously hard.
